column1: 4.2.4.3.2.1.1	Summary of evidence and recommendation for open and laparoscopic colposuspension surgery

High subjective cure rates are associated with both open and laparoscopic colposuspension for 
treatment of SUI.
Objective cure rates are higher for open compared to laparoscopic colposuspension.
Colposuspension is associated with a higher long-term risk of POP than MUS.

Laparoscopic colposuspension has a shorter hospital stay and may be more cost-effective than open 
colposuspension.

Laparoscopic colposuspension is associated with higher rates of intraoperative bladder perforation 
and postoperative voiding dysfunction compared to open colposuspension.

The rates of de novo urinary urgency following colposuspension are similar to other surgical 
treatments for SUI.
